channel.title: CNN.com - Tennis
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Tennis
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Shanghai success lifts Federer
item.description: The Fed Express rolls out of China with no signs of slowing down yet as Roger Federer moves back up to world No. 2 with Shanghai title.

item.title: Li Na: Tennis glitterati bid farewell
item.description: It was the long goodbye as China bid farewell to its sporting heroine in a tearful ceremony.

item.title: Nadal returns from three-month layoff
item.description: The last time Rafael Nadal came back from a long-term layoff, he enjoyed one of the finest seasons of an outstanding career -- reaching nine consecutive finals, and winning both the French and U.S. Open grand slams in 2013. On Tuesday, he began his latest comeback.

item.title: Federer like you've never seen him
item.description: Tennis star Roger Federer asked his 2.2m Twitter followers to send him on holiday to India... with hilarious results.

item.title: Nadal's uncle sparks sexism row
item.description: Toni Nadal is used to letting his famous nephew do the talking with his tennis racket -- and it sounds like it should stay that way if his comments about Spain's first female Davis Cup coach are anything to go by.

item.title: 'Crocodile' who broke all the rules
item.description: His distinctive crocodile logo is seen on clothing all over the world, but Rene Lacoste also left a lasting legacy in the development of tennis with his innovative creations.

item.title: Chinese trailblazer Li Na retires
item.description: Asia's first grand slam singles champion Li Na has called time on her 15-year tennis career due to "chronic" knee injuries.

item.title: The amazing life of Althea Gibson
item.description: Over the course of her remarkable life, Althea Gibson was many things to many people -- an accomplished jazz singer, a saxophone player, an actress and the first black woman to play on the professional golf circuit. But it was tennis where she really left her mark.

item.title: Serena savors New York success
item.description: Serena Williams is without peer in the modern women's game and now she is on a par with two American tennis legends from the past.

item.title: Will Djokovic be top dog again?
item.description: CNN's Christina McFarlane assesses the world No. 1's chances of retaining his ATP Tour Finals title.

item.title: Magnificent 7 for Fed at O2?
item.description: The 17-time grand slam champion is gunning for more glory at the season finale ATP Tour Finals in London.

item.title: Dominic Thiem: Austria's rising star
item.description: Pat Cash squares off against the youngest men's player in the ATP Tour's top 40. Meet Austria's rising star Dominic Thiem.

item.title: The mental strength of tennis pros
item.description: Former Wimbledon champion Marion Bartoli talks candidly to Open Court about the mental side of the game.

item.title: Wear and tear of the tennis season
item.description: Pat Cash hears how the players are feeling as the season winds down.

item.title: The breakfast of champions?
item.description: Open Court's Pat Cash and former top 10 player Barbara Schett look at the do's and don'ts of a tennis player's diet.

item.title: Davis Cup guide
item.description: Open Court explores which country will finish the year holding the prestigious Davis Cup trophy.

item.title: Nishikori on U.S. Open
item.description: Japanese star Kei Nishikori talks about being the first Asian man to reach a grand slam final.

item.title: Superfan's love for the Davis Cup
item.description: Switzerland fan Lillian Frei shows off her spirit and dedication to her home team.

item.title: Davis Cup vs. Roland Garros
item.description: CNN's Pat Cash explains the historic connections between Davis Cup and Roland Garros.

item.title: One on one with Ivanovic
item.description: Serbian star, Ana Ivanovic answers questions submitted to CNN's Open Court.

item.title: Becker surprise at reaction
item.description: Former champ talks about his coaching role with Novak Djokovic.

item.title: Althea Gibson's supreme legacy
item.description: Althea Gibson broke down color barriers in the 1950s when she won Wimbledon and the U.S. and French Open titles.

item.title: Tennis' love match
item.description: Martin Emmrich proposed to Michaella Krajicek on court at a grass court event.

item.title: Capturing iconic photographs
item.description: Clive Brunskill is one of the most famous tennis and sport photographers in the world.

item.title: The grass court season grows
item.description: In 2015 Wimbledon will happen one week later than usual, giving players extra time to adapt to the grass courts.

item.title: Champion Kvitova's 'perfect' match
item.description: 2014 Wimbledon winner Petra Kvitova discusses her "perfect" match against Eugenie Bouchard.

item.title: Czech star seeks second crown
item.description: Christina Macfarlane interviews 2011 Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova ahead of Saturday's final.

item.title: Inside Murray's luxury hotel
item.description: The 2013 Wimbledon champion on his exciting new hotel venture. Christina MacFarlane reports.

item.title: Wimbledon's luckiest wildcard?
item.description: Goran Ivanisevic talks about his "mysterious" Wimbledon victory in 2001. CNN's Pat Cash reports.

item.title: Wimbledon's 'giant umbrella' roof
item.description: Architect Rod Sheard reflects on the logistics of building Wimbledon's retractable roof.

item.title: Sharapova's SW19 triumph
item.description: Maria Sharapova recalls her big win a decade ago and how surprised she was to appear on the cover of Sports Illustrated.

item.title: Super Sharapova
item.description: French Open champion Maria Sharapova reflects on her fifth grand slam triumph.

item.title: Sharapova's love affair
item.description: Former French Open champion Maria Sharapova talks to Open Court about her passion for Paris.

item.title: Paris champions 25 years on
item.description: Open Court meets Michael Chang and Arantxa Sanchez Vicario 25 years after their Roland Garros wins.

item.title: Yannick Noah's magic moment
item.description: Pat Cash meets up with the French tennis superstar who is now better known for his recording career and son.

item.title: Watercolorist captures stars
item.description: A fixture at Roland Garros for nearly a decade, the talented Joel Blanc has painted the likes of Roger Federer and Maria Sharapova.

item.title: Djokovic to face Federer in blockbuster
item.description: Novak Djokovic became annoyed with the fans at the World Tour Finals on Saturday. Roger Federer wasn't too happy with the chair umpire. But both won their semifinals -- Federer saved match points -- to set up a blockbuster final.

item.title: Surging Djokovic secures top ranking
item.description: Novak Djokovic seals the year-end No.1 ranking for the third time as he crushes Tomas Berdych 6-2 6-2 in yet another lopsided encounter at the ATP World Tour Finals in London.

item.title: Federer knocks Murray out of ATP Finals
item.description: Britain's Andy Murray battled long and hard to make it to the ATP World Tour Finals but he may wish he hadn't following one of the most humiliating defeats of his career.

item.title: Magnificent 7 for Fed at O2?
item.description: The 17-time grand slam champion is gunning for more glory at the season finale ATP Tour Finals in London.

item.title: Wozniacki's big challenge
item.description: Former world No. 1 Caroline Wozniacki is training for the New York Marathon in early November.

item.title: World Tour Finals: Meet the elite eight
item.description: After the grand slams, it's the most prestigious men's tournament on the tennis tour. The World Tour Finals start Sunday in London and feature eight of the globe's top players.

item.title: Djokovic crushes Wawrinka at ATP Finals
item.description: Novak Djokovic has plenty of reasons to feel on top of the world -- but one more victory at the ATP World Tour finals will mean he ends 2014 as the leading ranked player on the planet.

item.title: Popcorn powers 'Woz' to marathon joy
item.description: She had nightmares about taking part in the New York City Marathon -- in one she even dreamed she was dead prior to getting to the start line -- but it turns out Caroline Wozniacki need not have worried.

item.title: Revenge so sweet for Serena
item.description: Four days after suffering a humbling defeat to Simona Halep, Serena Williams turns the tables on the Romanian to win a fifth WTA Finals title with a crushing straights sets 6-3 6-0 victory in Singapore Sunday.

item.title: Serena angry over Russian chief's remarks
item.description: Serena Williams slams Russian tennis chief Shamil Tarpischev for his "insensitive, sexist and racist" remarks in describing her and sister Venus as the "Williams brothers" on a late night TV chat show.

item.title: Which woman will be world's best?
item.description: The season-ending championship of women's tennis -- the WTA Finals -- is almost upon as the world's top female players prepare to do battle in Singapore. Who will roar loudest in the "Lion City?"

item.title: Shooting stars: Dog track to SW19
item.description: Clive Brunskill is one of the world's finest tennis photographers, but his work goes beyond the court.

item.title: The rise, fall and rise of Ivanovic
item.description: The rise and fall and rise of Ana Ivanovic

item.title: Turbulent tennis love matches
item.description: Speculation abounds that sport's foremost golf and tennis love match have called it quits. Double major winner Rory McIlroy and former world No. 1 Caroline Wozniacki are staying tight lipped on their alleged break up, but when it comes to sport the path of true love rarely runs smooth.

item.title: On court with Ivanisevic
item.description: Goran Ivanisevic talks about his "mysterious" Wimbledon victory in 2001. CNN's Pat Cash reports.

item.title: A workout with the 'Running Man'
item.description: Can Pat Cash handle a warm-up workout with David "The Running Man" Ferrer?

item.title: Navratilova vs. Cash
item.description: Open Court's Pat Cash takes to the court with 18-time grand slam winner Martina Navratilova.
